channel.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
channel.description: > # [color = "gray"]The Accomplice[/color] :shield: > **[color = "gray"]Neutral Investigative[/color]** > Passive: Tricks of the trade - Night immune once > > Day ability: Snitch - Target player will receive your night results tonight in addition to you. (Unlimited) > > Night ability 1: Stalk - Learn the targets class, who visits them and who they visited.(Unlimited) > Night ability 2: Sabotage - Target player does not receive any feedback whatsoever tonight. (4 uses) > > Goal: Survive to see the BD fall.

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
NightX:

as long as you have the upper hand

For me, this is the issue. Once you lose the upper hand, if the Alch is alive, BD is in a really tight spot. Additionally:

  • No guarantee of BD King - many Alchs will simply be the King’s gopher, no matter the faction.
  • If Evils don’t start dying quickly, siding with Evil/Neuts starts quickly looking more attractive to Alch
  • Alch can say they’re healing BD when they are not in an attempt to stay neutral.
  • Alchemists are completely unreliable late game and can turn on you for any reason.

I’m not saying “Neuts out”, always kill Neuts, etc. Of course it depends on the situation. If there is any other credible lead, I’d obviously try to exe an Evil over an Alch. All I’m saying is that I’m perfectly willing to kill Alchemists early for the reasons above.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Why? You’re killing a healer.

They can be turned, but generally as long as you have the upper hand, they can prevent BD losses and can’t be converted. The only reason to kill them is if they decide to yolo bomb you.

Of course, if you have reason to believe they are fake claiming, you should certainly kill them.

The extra healer is worth having someone who could flip around.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
NightX:

There is no good reason to kill an Alchemist, for example, so it is basically a BD aligned class.

I disagree. I usually vote to exe Alchemists because they will always turn on you when it would benefit them. That malleability and unreliability is the heart of Neutral classes.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Survival is an interesting goal, but only if there is a reason to kill them.

There is no good reason to kill an Alchemist, for example, so it is basically a BD aligned class.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
Livicus:

Just survive classes are lame

I guess we’ll have to agree to disagree here. I like Survive classes and think they’re fun.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
I mean like, it has Survive in the win con, Just survive classes are lame

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
It’s not going to be to survive.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Although if it is to survive, then I think this would be more suitable instead of the Tricks of the Trade Passive.

Trickery: (D) (2)
Make yourself Night Immune tonight.

This way, it’s not a guaranteed Night Immunity once, but he can choose to be night immune twice. And there’s more strategy, as the Accomplice can choose to either Snitch or use Trickery that night.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Okay then I think that the current win con of surviving to see BD fall is perfectly fine then

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Leaders are not official.

In fact I am fairly sure that if they were then sheriff and pally are on that list too.

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
I guess official leaders maybe?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Not quite what I had in mind. Also 2 problems.

1: Neutrals are not leaders. Especially the non-NK ones

2: That’s far more arbitrary than what I had and thus harder to remember.

How do you determine if someone is a leader? That’s not a trait of the class itself. For example I consider the hunter a leader and yet it’s not on your list.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Would this work?

Survive to see only leaders of each faction be alive.

Leaders:
Neutral Killer
Mastermind
Cult Leader
King
Prince

Even then, I still feel that a simple win con like
“Survive to see the Blue Dragon fall” is perfectly fine too.

Scorned, Fool, these are Neutral classes that are 95% of the time bad for the Blue Dragon. It wouldn’t be devestating for the Accomplice to be part of this group too in my opinion. And I suspect that the BD has the highest win rate currently.

Read full topic

item.description:
To what?

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Every faction is guaranteed to have at least one of these so you can win with any faction. I am willing to change the class finder to a type finder with this change.

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Survival ones are boring though, so should we go down the line for win cons?

Survive to see the Blue Dragon fall.

Survive and end the game by Day 7.

Survive to see both major factions die. (BD & Scum)

Survive to ensure the Neutral Killer wins.

Make sure a Neutral Killer wins.

Survive and prevent any smart Neutrals from dying. (Does not include Fool)

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I may be willing to debate the wincon. But I am not going with a survival wincon. That would accomplish NONE of the goals I am trying to achieve with this class.

item.title: [Class Suggestion]The Accomplice - Neutral Investigative
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
Livicus:

What if the Accomplice’s goal is to ensure a Neutral Killer wins?

That’s also a huge buff to NK - NK should be alone at the beginning of the game.

I’d say Goal: To survive until the end of the game.

It works for Alch, it could work for Accomplice. Accomplice could put her efforts toward helping whoever she chooses. It would feel very different to play than the Alchemist.

Read full topic
